bestBHT.bht: Jesus acknowledges that the power exerted over Him by men is distinct from the power of the Evil One, and this demonstrates God's sovereign plan. By voluntarily submitting to the power of darkness, Jesus willingly endures betrayal and injustice, knowing the moral value of His sacrificial death lies in His obedience. However, this dark hour will be followed by a better day, allowing hope for the triumph over evil.

Henry Alford: But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.
Our Lord here distinguishes between the power exercised over Him by men, and that by the Evil One.
His own assertion of this shews that all was by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God.
Philip Schaff: But this is your hour, and the power of darkness."
Power of darkness' therefore points to the kingdom of darkness."
This clause suggests mysterious, and as yet unexplained, facts in regard to the relation of God’s purpose, man’s agency, and Satanic power.
Archibald T. Robertson: The moral value of his atoning sacrifice on the Cross consists in the voluntariness of his death.
He makes it clear that they have taken undue advantage of him in this hour of secret prayer.
But 'the power of darkness' had its turn. A better day will come.
John Gill: This was but an hour, a short time that they had to triumph over him... for on the third day he arose again.
Since then, it has been his hour to take vengeance on them; on their nation, city, and temple, for their disbelief, rejection, and ill usage of him.

Now was the time come, that Christ should be delivered up into the hands of wicked men and devils... all which Christ endured, to deliver his people from the present evil world, from the wrath of God, the curses of the law, and from the power of darkness.
John Wesley: This is your hour — Before which ye could not take me: and the power of darkness - The time when Satan has power.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Luke 22:53, Jesus acknowledges that the power exerted over Him by men is distinct from the power of the Evil One. By asserting this, Jesus confirms that everything that transpires is according to God's plan. He willingly submits to the power of darkness, allowing it to have its turn, knowing the moral value of His sacrificial death lies in the voluntary nature of His obedience. However, this dark hour of betrayal and injustice will be followed by a better day.

Jesus acknowledges that the power exerted over Him by men is distinct from the power of the Evil One, and this demonstrates God's sovereign plan. By voluntarily submitting to the power of darkness, Jesus willingly endures betrayal and injustice, knowing the moral value of His sacrificial death lies in His obedience. However, this dark hour will be followed by a better day, allowing hope for the triumph over evil.

Jesus distinguishes between the power exerted over Him by men and the power of the Evil One, indicating that everything that happens is part of God’s plan. His willingness to submit to the power of darkness highlights the voluntary nature of His sacrificial death. This hour of betrayal and unjust treatment serves a greater purpose, as a better day will come.

Jesus acknowledges the power of darkness exerted over Him by men, contrasting it with the power of the Evil One. This distinction reveals the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God. Jesus willingly endures this hour of betrayal and injustice, recognizing the moral value of His sacrificial death. However, He affirms that a better day will come, suggesting that the power of darkness has its turn, but it is ultimately limited, and redemption and restoration are on the horizon.

Jesus acknowledges that the power exerted over Him by men is distinct from the power of the Evil One. By asserting this, Jesus confirms that everything that transpires is according to God's plan. He willingly submits to the power of darkness, allowing it to have its turn, knowing the moral value of His sacrificial death lies in the voluntary nature of His obedience. However, this dark hour of betrayal and injustice will be followed by a better day.
